entities: International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
summary:
The Security Council,

Adopting resolution 1849 (2008) at its 6040th meeting on 12 December 2008,

Noting the International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia's need for additional ad litem Judges,

Recalling resolutions 1800 (2008), 1503 (2003), and 1534 (2004),

Decides that the Secretary-General may appoint additional ad litem Judges, 

Within existing resources, upon request of the President of the International Tribunal,

To complete existing trials or conduct additional trials, 

Notwithstanding the maximum of twelve ad litem Judges in article 12 (1) of the Statute,

To a maximum of sixteen at any one time until 28 February 2009,

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
